title: Best Core i9 laptops in 2025 | Windows Central
summary: Intel's Core i9 and Core Ultra 9 CPUs are among the industry's most powerful processors, and the laptops that feature them are phenomenal.
full_text: Intel's top-tier CPUs come from the Core i9 and, more recently, Core Ultra 9 brands. They're capable of powering through heavy workloads or driving top-notch gaming experiences, and the best Windows laptops featuring the chips are generally among the best on the market. These laptops are designed to suit the needs of gamers and professionals, and you can count on the PCs to deliver awesome horsepower, especially when paired with a capable GPU. Although Dell's XPS 16 and Samsung's Galaxy Book4 Ultra are a couple of favorites that the Windows Central team has tested and reviewed, there are some amazing alternatives available for different types of users. June 11, 2025: The XPS 16 and the Galaxy Book4 Ultra remain my top two picks for most people, but I've updated the guide with Lenovo's new Legion Pro 7i (Gen 10) and HP's OMEN MAX 16 for PC gamers. — Cale Hunt The quick list Best overall With up to an Intel Core Ultra 9 185H CPU, NVIDIA RTX 4070 Laptop GPU, UHD+ OLED display, and unique, futuristic design, the XPS 16 (9640) is our top pick when it comes to laptops with Intel's most powerful chips. Read more below 2. Samsung Galaxy Book4 Ultra Runner-up Samsung's Galaxy Book4 Ultra is a thinner and lighter alternative to the XPS 16. It has a more traditional design, but it boasts a gorgeous AMOLED display, Core Ultra 9 185H CPU, NVIDIA RTX 4070 Laptop GPU, and a better selection of ports. Read more below 3. Lenovo Legion Pro 7i (Gen 10) Most power The Legion Pro 7i (Gen 10) is the right choice for most gamers thanks to super performance from a Core Ultra 9 275HX CPU and up to an NVIDIA RTX 5090 Laptop GPU. The QHD+ OLED display has a 240Hz refresh rate with Dolby Vision and G-Sync, the keyboard is great, and there's RGB lighting everywhere. Read more below Gaming alternative HP's OMEN MAX 16 is a stellar gaming laptop that starts at a much more reasonable price compared to the Legion Pro 7i and Razer Blade 18. Many hardware configs are available, including up to an NVIDIA RTX 5090 Laptop GPU to go with the Core Ultra 9 275HX CPU. Read more below Premium gaming For those with deep pockets, there is always the Razer Blade 18. It's much sleeker than the Alienware option, yet it boasts up to Core Ultra 9 275HX CPU with up to an NVIDIA RTX 5090 Laptop GPU. The display comes in mini-LED with a 300Hz refresh rate or 4K at 200Hz. Read more below Our favorite Core i9 and Core Ultra 9 laptops in 2025 Why you can trust Windows Central Our expert reviewers spend hours testing and comparing products and services so you can choose the best for you. Find out more about how we test . Best overall Core Ultra 9 laptop Dell's XPS 16 (9640) is our favorite Core Ultra 9 laptop thanks to a futuristic design and outstanding display. (Image credit: Rebecca Spear / Windows Central) The best Core Ultra 9 AI PC Specifications CPU: Up to Intel Core Ultra 9 185H GPU: Up to NVIDIA RTX 4070 Laptop Memory: Up to 64GB LPDDR5X Storage: Up to 4TB M.2 PCIe 4.0 NVMe SSD Ports: Up to three Thunderbolt 4, 3.5mm audio, microSD card reader Display: 16.3 inches, up to 3840x2400 (UHD+), OLED, touch, anti-reflective, 400 nits Reasons to buy + Powerful AI PC performance + Gorgeous minimalist design + Beautiful 3.2K OLED display + Amazing speakers for a laptop + Good battery life Reasons to avoid - Lattice-free keyboard, touch function buttons, hidden touchpad might not be for you - No webcam shutter - No native USB-A or HDMI Dell's XPS 16 (9640) is one of our favorite AI laptops if you're looking for a lot of power in a slim and modern design. The lattice-free keyboard, touch function buttons, and seamless glass haptic touchpad might take some getting used to, but the features come together to create a beautiful laptop. There are a number of configurations available at a cheaper price, but I'm focusing here on the Core Ultra 9 185H CPU available with either an NVIDIA RTX 4060 or RTX 4070 Laptop graphics card (GPU). These models have up to 64GB of LPDDR5x-6400MHz RAM (soldered), as well as up to 4TB of M.2 PCIe 4.0 NVMe solid-state drive (SSD) storage. Two 16.3-inch displays are available, no matter the config. The entry option has a 1920x1200 (FHD+) resolution, anti-glare finish, 500 nits brightness, and 120Hz variable refresh rate (VRR) to be easier on the eyes. For about $300 more, an OLED display with 3840x2400 (UHD+) resolution, anti-reflective finish, and 120Hz VRR is available. Windows Central's Rebecca Spear reviewed the XPS 16 (9640) with OLED display, in which she noted that it "makes for a beautiful viewing experience when playing games, watching shows, or working in creative software." Dell announced a massive rebrand of its laptops at CES 2025 , and the XPS 16 appears to be one of the last models to come out of the legendary lineup. Although Dell's renamed laptops are launching in the near future, the XPS 16 remains a top option with tons of power and a gorgeous display. 👀 Read our full Dell XPS 16 (9640) review Runner-up Core Ultra 9 laptop

title: Intel Core i9 Windows Laptops - Best Buy
summary: Shop for Intel Core i9 Windows Laptops at Best Buy. Find low everyday prices and buy online for delivery or in-store pick-up
full_text: Whether you’re a student, a creative professional, a gamer or someone seeking a reliable work companion, there is a laptop for everybody. Moreso, with so many options to choose from when shopping for a new laptop, it seems like laptop computer technology is improving every second. You can help yourself stay ahead of the curve and choose wisely by narrowing down the type of laptop you need. Some laptop types are defined by primary use, such as gaming laptops , which prioritize the elements needed to play popular video games—like a dedicated graphics card. Some types are based on specific design features, such as touchscreen laptops and 2-in-1 laptops , which combine some abilities of a tablet with traditional laptop features. Whether if you are choosing the best laptop for a college student , looking for an ideal laptop for working from home or for a combination of work and play, you should start by making decisions about the type of design that will benefit you most. A touchscreen is very useful for photo editing and digital artwork tasks. However, it’s unnecessary for most other tasks. Similarly, if you’re mostly using your laptop for word processing or streaming movies, a gaming laptop with stellar specs might be heavier and less portable than you would like.
